column5: Hōnengame is an aquatic yōkai from Japanese folklore. It has the body of a large turtle with a human woman's head, long black hair, and sometimes horns, and is said to possess fortune-telling abilities.

} Hōnengyo is a type of Japanese yōkai that appears as a strange fish or amphibian-like creature with scales like a snake and legs like a turtle. It is said to inhabit rivers and is believed to be a good omen, often appearing before years with bountiful catches. }

Ikuchi is a colossal sea monster from Japanese folklore that roams the open seas off the coasts of Japan. It appears in numerous stories, described as enormous fish or serpents with slippery bodies and tentacle-like appendages.

Kagewani is a creature from Japanese folklore that appears as a large predatory fish in the Sea of Japan. It has the ability to devour human shadows, which causes the person's disappearance and eventual death.
